#### **About the job Analista de Inventario**


**Descripción del Puesto:**


Asegurar la ventaja competitiva de la organización mediante la disponibilidad de productos. Analizar las
  

proyecciones y el movimiento real de los productos, entre otras iniciativas que resulten en reducción de costos
  

para aumentar la eficiencia del departamento. Manejar oportunamente las necesidades de informes y
  

requisiciones de información recibidas en el departamento de Compras.
**Responsabilidades Principales:**



1\. Analizar los movimientos de los productos utilizando diversos métodos, entre estos, pero no se limita a, los reportes de consumo de Acumatica para identificar los movimientos de los productos y mantener el
  

safety stock.
  

2\. Actualizar los resultados en el sistema de Acumatica luego de realizar el análisis del movimiento de los productos, con el fin de apoyar a los Compradores en la colocación de órdenes y con las unidades de
  

Ventas para asegurar si hay algún producto que debe ser inactivado o cambiado de clasificación A, B o C.
  

3\. Analizar los suplidores e identificar de manera proactiva las razones de las fluctuaciones, referir los hallazgos al Gerente de Compras y a los Compradores al igual de hacer los cambios en sistema de Acumatica de ser necesarios.
  

4\. Revisar periódicamente el safety stock y las clasificaciones A, B o C de los artículos. Esto implica, pero no se limita a, evaluar las variaciones en las ventas de cada producto, tanto incrementos como disminuciones
  

o ningún movimiento y mantener una comunicación oportuna con el personal designado en los departamentos de Ventas Diagnósticas, Ventas Especializadas, Especialistas de Aplicaciones y Cadena de Suministro para facilitar los ajustes necesarios en las clasificaciones A, B y C, determinar ventas especiales u otras estrategias, así como para actualizar y calendarizar la información en el sistema de Acumatica según corresponda.
  

5\. Analizar el historial de ventas, para las líneas de ventas diagnóstico y especializadas, hospitalaria y las proyecciones presentadas por los departamentos de Atención al Cliente y Gerencia de Proyectos. Esto
  

incluye el análisis del consumo a base de las ventas de los equipos o productos y la creación y/o actualización de las proyecciones de ventas (forecast), entiéndase lo que se necesitará ordenar en los próximos meses y enviarlos a los suplidores para garantizar que las cantidades de producción sean las más precisas posibles, evitando la falta de mercancía al momento de realizar los pedidos.  

6\. Crear artículos nuevos en el sistema de Acumatica, mantenimiento de los artículos existentes y la desactivación de los artículos descontinuados, según solicitado por el departamento de Ventas. Esto incluye, pero sin limitarse a, la adición, revisión y/o redefinición de las descripciones de los artículos conforme la estandarización establecida, verificar y asegurar la precisión de las unidades de medidas y alertar a las áreas operacionales que sean requeridas para la administración correcta.
  

7\. Actualizar el reporte de safety stock en Excel con los cambios en los indicadores clave de inventarios, con énfasis en aspectos como el consumo, manejo, desperdicio y controles de inventarios.  

8\. Analizar y estableces parámetros de la data que se incluye en el reporte de safety stock como fluctuaciones en la demanda, variaciones estacionales, eficiencias operativas y posibles áreas de mejora, entre otros.  

9\. Realizar el proceso de conteo cíclico semanal, realizando el reporte, conteo e identificación de discrepancia para notificar los resultados al departamento de Logística.  

10\. Participar en los inventarios generales, proceso de inventarios físicos cíclicos y anuales en los diferentes almacenes, además de investigar, analizar y documentar las discrepancias en el inventario y los ajustes correspondientes en el sistema de Acumatica.  

11\. Realizar la investigación, análisis y documentación de discrepancias en el inventario y sus ajustes correspondientes y comunicar el resultado al departamento de Logística, ya sean por inventarios cíclicos, señalamientos de Cumplimiento y Calidad y/o en el recibo de la mercancía.  

12\. Actualizar en el sistema de Acumatica los mantenimientos a los productos en el inventario para garantizar que todos los datos estén correctos y completos según solicitado por el Departamento de Cumplimiento y Calidad, Ventas o el Gerente de Compras.  

13\. Aportar activamente al mantenimiento de la misión y al logro de la visión de la compañía; y ejemplificar con su desempeño y conducta la filosofía de la cultura de eficiencia, los valores y los principios de un servicio al cliente interno y externo de la más alta calidad.


**Requisitos Académicos y Experiencia:**


* Grado Asociado en Administración de Empresas o campo relacionado.
* *Se puede considerar experiencia relevante si no se posee título en el área.*
* Mínimo 1 año de experiencia en roles similares o funciones relacionadas con inventario, compras o análisis de datos.


**Competencias y Habilidades Clave:**


* Excelentes habilidades de análisis de datos, identificación de patrones y toma de decisiones.
* Atención al detalle y enfoque en la calidad de la información.
* Dominio de Excel, Outlook.
* Comunicación clara y efectiva en español e inglés (verbal y escrita).
* Disposición para laborar en horarios extendidos, fines de semana y feriados, según se requiera.
* Enfoque en servicio al cliente interno y externo.

***Validation \& Engineering Group, Inc.*** (V\&EG) is a leading services supplier who provides solutions for the Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology, Chemical, Food, and Medical Devices industries in the following areas: Laboratory, Compliance, Computer, Engineering, Project Management, Validation, and other services.


We are seeking a talented, dedicated individual committed to work under the highest ethics standards for the following position:


Senior Engineer \- Biotechnology Packaging (Vials, Syringes, SureClick)


Job Summary:


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Engineer to lead the development and optimization of packaging systems for biotechnology products, including vials, syringes, and SureClick auto\-injectors. The ideal candidate will bring extensive expertise in primary and secondary packaging design, development, testing, and validation, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards while driving innovation and sustainability.


Key Responsibilities:


* Packaging Development:


* Design, develop, and validate innovative packaging solutions for biotechnology products, including vials, prefilled syringes, and SureClick auto\-injectors.


* Lead packaging component selection, material compatibility studies, and design optimization for functionality and patient ease\-of\-use.


* Regulatory Compliance:


* Ensure all packaging solutions meet global regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA, ISO).


* Author and review technical documentation, including design protocols, reports, and regulatory submissions.


* Testing and Validation:


* Oversee packaging testing processes, including container closure integrity, extractables and leachables, and mechanical performance.


* Lead design verification and validation activities to support product launch and lifecycle management.


* Cross\-functional Collaboration:


* Partner with R\&D, manufacturing, quality, and supply chain teams to ensure seamless integration of packaging systems into production processes.


* Work with external suppliers and contractors to source and qualify packaging materials and components.


* Innovation and Sustainability:


* Stay updated on the latest packaging technologies and trends in biotechnology and pharmaceuticals.


* Drive initiatives to improve sustainability, reduce costs, and enhance patient\-centric design.


Qualifications:


* Education:


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (e.g., Mechanical, Biomedical, Chemical, Packaging) or a related field.


* Experience:


* Minimum 8\-10 years of experience in packaging engineering within the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, or medical device industries.


* Proven expertise with vials, prefilled syringes, and auto\-injector devices such as SureClick.


* Technical Skills:


* Strong knowledge of packaging design, material science, and manufacturing processes.


* Familiarity with industry standards (e.g., ASTM, USP, ISO) and regulatory guidelines for packaging.


* Experience with Computer\-Aided Design (CAD) and packaging simulation tools.


* Soft Skills:


* Excellent problem\-solving and analytical abilities.


* Strong project management and leadership skills.


* Effective communication and ability to work in cross\-functional teams.


Preferred Skills:


* Hands\-on experience with cold\-chain packaging for biologics.


* Knowledge of serialization and track\-and\-trace requirements.


* Familiarity with automation and robotics in packaging processes.


Work Environment:


* Full\-time position with occasional travel to manufacturing sites and suppliers.


* Collaborative and dynamic work environment in a biotechnology\-focused organization.

**Resumen de posición:**  

El Gerente del Restaurante es responsable de supervisar todas las facetas de la operación y garantizar la calidad en la preparación y presentación de las comidas. Mantiene los estándares de servicio y limpieza en todo momento. Un gerente de restaurante utiliza el desempeño anterior, las condiciones del mercado y la planificación estratégica para pronosticar la oferta y la demanda. Él o ella coordina todas las actividades, incluidas la gestión, las relaciones con los clientes y el mercadeo para garantizar la eficiencia y la rentabilidad. Requiere experiencia significativa en varias facetas de la industria de restaurantes o campo relacionado; y/o un título en un campo relacionado.  

  

**Tareas de trabajo:**
  

* Desarrollar estrategias de ahorro de costos para aumentar las utilidades y administrar los costos laborales.
* Proporcionar capacitación para garantizar que se cumplan los objetivos de desempeño.
* Proporcionar liderazgo y trabajo en equipo para el personal.
* Investigar y resolver problemas de calidad de alimentos (prueba) y quejas de servicio.
* Disciplinar al personal apropiadamente de acuerdo con las políticas y procedimientos. Estricta comunicación con el Depto. Recursos Humanos.
* Crear y mantener el horario del personal y realizar un seguimiento del ausentismo y puntualidad.
* Mantener altos estándares de control de calidad, seguridad y salud.
* Supervisar y coordinar las actividades del equipo de servicio, cocina y limpieza durante el turno asignado. Evitar la recarga de trabajo en personal, distribuir de forma equitativa.
* Utiliza las herramientas provistas por la compañía para el cumplimiento (subir facturas, inventario, entre otros).
* Conocer el personal administrativo para canalizar cada situación de la operación general del restaurante de manera eficiente y efectiva.
* Garantizar la satisfacción del cliente y la calidad del servicio, manteniendo los estándares de limpieza y seguridad alimentaria.
* Responsable de la integración y adiestramiento de nuevos talentos. Capacitar, motivar y guiar al personal en la realización de sus tareas diarias, proporcionando retroalimentación.
* Mantener surtida la tienda, atender las compras, velar el inventario, comunicación con suplidores y demás personal administrativo para asistir en el cumplimiento de ordenes al centro entre otros.
* Garantizar la disponibilidad de productos del menú en el restaurante en todo momento, producciones.
* Administrar el registro de efectivo y tarjetas de crédito, realizar cierres de caja y preparar informes (reportes) diarios.
* Realizar depósitos en el banco.
* Registrar los consumos de los empleados (descuentos), realizando el proceso correcto que estipula la compañía y auditarlos.
* Resolver problemas y conflictos que puedan surgir durante el turno y tomar decisiones rápidas y efectivas.
* Supervisa al personal para garantizar el cumplimiento del código de vestimenta establecido por la compañía.
* Mantener altos estándares de control de calidad, seguridad y salud.
* Dar seguimiento a las compras recibidas en el restaurante, guardar los artículos en sus respectivos lugares, rotación de productos y disminuir los descartes por pérdida de temperatura, entre otros.

**Principales Responsabilidades, Conocimientos Requeridos y Habilidades:**  

* Servicio al cliente: El gerente del restaurante sirve como modelo a seguir y establece el estándar para que todos los empleados mantengan un servicio al cliente consistente y de alta calidad. Esto requiere un conocimiento avanzado de las mejores prácticas de la industria y servicio al cliente.
* Comunicación: Este puesto requiere un compromiso con los detalles tanto verbal como no verbalmente, por lo tanto, el gerente del restaurante debe fomentar niveles de comunicación cooperativos y consistentes con el personal de cocina, el personal de recepción y la gerencia. Debe comprender las instrucciones, leer los memorandos escritos de la empresa y comunicarse con poca o ninguna instrucción adicional.
* Relaciones interpersonales\- Debe adaptarse a las diferentes personalidades de los clientes, proveedores y compañeros de trabajo sin perder el enfoque. Debe poseer una alta ética profesional y evitar la familiaridad extrema o los conflictos con los demás.
* Liderazgo y Gestión: Debe comprender y practicar técnicas de gestión motivacional. Debe utilizar estas habilidades para colocar sabiamente a personas calificadas en puestos clave de gestión y supervisión.
* Delegar\- Asigna tareas distribuyendo las cargas de manera equitativa para no recargar de trabajos a su personal.
* Capacitación y desarrollo\- Proporcionar instrucción a los miembros del personal y capacitar a los empleados para mejorar el aprendizaje y mejorar el desempeño.
* Resolución de problemas, control de calidad y evaluación de prioridades: debe evaluar las prácticas y procesos actuales; reconocer inmediatamente áreas potenciales de conflicto; e iniciar formas de mejorar los métodos comerciales actuales, la calidad de los productos y servicios proporcionados a los clientes.
* Manejo de conflictos: El Gerente de Restaurante debe reconocer un problema cuando se presenta y ser capaz de resolverlo adecuadamente usando buen juicio, tacto e iniciativa de acuerdo con la política y procedimiento de la empresa. Requiere habilidades de mediación a menudo imparciales para manejar todo tipo de conflictos que ocurrirán en todos los niveles de supervisión y la capacidad de negociar de manera efectiva, todo esto en comunicación con Depto. de Recursos Humanos.
* Recopilación de información: Debe identificar y utilizar fuentes internas y externas para mejorar y mantener los objetivos de la empresa.
* Técnicas de ventas e influencia en el cliente: Debe comprender los productos y servicios, desarrollar nuevas perspectivas de oportunidades y comprender claramente las necesidades de los clientes. También debe poseer una experiencia sustancial y mantenerse al día en los métodos de venta más avanzados. Debe establecer y cumplir objetivos de ventas.
* Realización de actividades físicas generales\- Los gerentes de restaurantes ocasionalmente deben realizar actividades físicas en una variedad de condiciones ambientales que requieren una fuerza de moderada a máxima, como sentarse, escalar, levantar objetos, equilibrarse, caminar y manipular materiales.
* Flexibilidad: Debe trabajar horas extras cuando sea necesario y ayudar con la carga de trabajo de los demás.
* Educación: Graduado de escuela secundaria o título de educación general (GED), se prefiere una licenciatura
* Limpieza\- Conocimiento de los estándares de limpieza y seguridad alimentaria.
* Empatía\- Un líder debe ser capaz de entender las necesidades y preocupaciones de su equipo y ser sensible a sus emociones.
* Humildad\- Reconocer que no tiene todas las respuestas, y estar dispuesto a aprender de su equipo y de sus errores.
* Compromiso y dedicación\- Estar comprometido y dedicado a su equipo y a su trabajo.
* Habilidades analíticas: Debe usar la lógica y la razón para identificar soluciones y alternativas para un resultado exitoso en muchas situaciones, incluido el análisis de costo/beneficio; calidad del servicio y del producto; y resolución de conflictos.

Todo lo que te mueve, en un solo lugar Car One es una compañía referente en la industria automotriz con más de 27 años de trayectoria, que ofrece un universo integral de soluciones de movilidad. En cuanto a la comercialización de vehículos, pone a disposición de sus clientes la mayor selección de Usados Garantizados y una gama diversificada de autos 0 KM de más de 10 marcas líderes, entre ellas, Chevrolet, Fiat, Peugeot, Renault y Volkswagen, a las que recientemente se sumaron Great Wall Motors, Mitsubishi, además de Jeep y Ram del Grupo Stellantis. A su vez, Car One ofrece soluciones para cada punto de contacto en el vínculo entre las personas y sus vehículos: financiación, planes de ahorro, servicios de postventa con talleres oficiales y propios, repuestos y accesorios originales, gomería, agente de seguros, escribanía propia, instalación de Telepase para autopistas, y alquiler de flotas corporativas y autos particulares, entre muchísimas soluciones más. **Guaynabo, PR**


**ABOUT US**


*At Triple S, we are committed to provide meaningful job experiences for Valuable People (Gente Valiosa). We encourage an environment of very high ethical standards, always excelling in service,* ***collaboration*** *among the company****, agility*** *to deliver timely, and embracing* ***accountability*** *for results.*

We serve more than 1 million consumers in Puerto Rico through our Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, Commercial, Life and Property \& Casualty Businesses.*


*Let's build healthier communities together, join now!*

  



**ABOUT THE ROLE**


Strategic technology leader responsible for defining, governing, and delivering enterprise\-wide architecture solutions across cloud platforms, infrastructure services, and solution delivery. This role plays a critical part in architecting and delivering complex initiatives, ensuring that solutions are scalable, secure, and aligned with business and digital transformation goals. The architect will lead solution architecture efforts, collaborating with cross\-functional teams to design and implement robust, future\-ready systems. Additionally, the role will oversee delivery execution, driving modernization, optimizing performance, and enabling innovation across the enterprise.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

**Cloud \& Infrastructure Architecture*** Define and evolve enterprise architecture standards for cloud (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and infrastructure (compute, storage, network).
* Lead the design and implementation of hybrid and multi\-cloud environments, ensuring interoperability, governance, and cost optimization.
* Architect cloud\-native solutions using containers, serverless, and microservices patterns.
* Drive infrastructure modernization efforts including virtualization, automation, and orchestration.

**Solution Architecture \& Delivery*** Lead solutioning for enterprise initiatives, translating business requirements into scalable, secure, and resilient technical architectures.
* Collaborate with engineering, product, and operations teams to design and deliver end\-to\-end solutions across cloud, infrastructure, applications, and data.
* Evaluate and recommend technology stacks, platforms, and tools to support solution delivery and long\-term sustainability.
* Ensure solutions adhere to enterprise architecture principles, security standards, and operational best practices.
* Provide architectural leadership in RFP/RFI processes, vendor evaluations, and implementation planning.

**Governance \& Standards*** Establish and enforce architecture principles, reference models, and reusable design patterns for cloud and infrastructure domains.
* Lead architecture review boards and ensure compliance with enterprise policies, regulatory requirements, and security frameworks.
* Define and implement standards for identity and access management, encryption, and data protection across platforms.

**Leadership \& Collaboration*** Serve as a trusted advisor to senior leadership, influencing strategic decisions through architectural insights and solutioning expertise.
* Partner with application, data, and security architects to ensure cohesive and integrated enterprise architecture.
* Mentor and guide junior architects and engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, technical excellence, and continuous learning.
* Manage relationships with cloud providers, infrastructure vendors, and strategic partners.


**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field. 12\+ years of experience in IT architecture, with deep expertise in cloud and infrastructure domains. AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Professional, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, or Google Professional Cloud Architect.

**Job Description: Supervisor of Distribution and Logistics**
=============================================================

**Department:** Operations / Logistics  

**Reports to:** Operations Manager  

**Location:** Cayey  

**Position Type:** Full\-time

**Job Purpose**
---------------


Supervise and coordinate daily distribution and logistics operations, ensuring compliance with quality, efficiency, and safety standards in product handling. The role guarantees that transportation, storage, and delivery processes meet organizational goals and applicable regulations.

**Main Responsibilities**
-------------------------

* Plan, organize, and supervise distribution, dispatch, and transportation activities.
* Coordinate inbound and outbound product flow, ensuring on\-time and proper deliveries.
* Supervise warehouse staff, drivers, and logistics assistants, fostering a safe and productive work environment.
* Control inventories, verifying accuracy in records and reconciliations.
* Implement logistics and distribution performance indicators (KPIs), including delivery times, costs, route efficiency, and inventory accuracy.
* Ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations (occupational safety, traffic, transportation standards).
* Prepare operational performance reports and propose process improvements.
* Coordinate with purchasing, sales, and customer service departments to ensure customer satisfaction and supply chain efficiency.
* Handle unforeseen situations such as delays, returns, accidents, or product damages, ensuring fast and effective solutions.

**Job Requirements**
--------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Logistics, Industrial Engineering, or related field (master’s degree preferred).
* Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in logistics, distribution, or transportation positions.
* Proven experience supervising work teams.
* Strong knowledge of inventory management, route control, and transportation.
* Advanced skills in Excel, ERP systems, or WMS (Warehouse Management System).
* Knowledge of occupational safety standards and transportation regulations.
* Strong leadership, problem\-solving, and communication skills.

**Key Competencies**
--------------------

* **Leadership** and ability to supervise multidisciplinary teams.
* **Planning and organization** to optimize resources and time.
* **Results\-oriented** mindset, focused on meeting operational goals.
* **Analytical skills** for interpreting logistics indicators.
* **Ability to work under pressure** and manage critical situations.
* **Effective communication** with all organizational levels.

**Working Conditions**
----------------------

* Operational environment in warehouse and field (mixed administrative/operational).
* Availability for extended hours or weekends in exceptional cases.
* Regular interaction with drivers, suppliers, and internal clients.

**Facilities Manager****Job ID**243388
**Posted**15\-Oct\-2025
**Service line**GWS Segment
**Role type**Full\-time
**Areas of Interest**Facilities Management


**Location(s)**San Juan \- Puerto Rico \- United States of America


**About the Role:**
As a CBRE Facilities Manager, you will manage a team responsible for providing overseeing building operations and maintenance for a facility, campus, or portfolio of small to medium sized buildings.


This job is a part of the Facilities Management functional area which focuses on all aspects of the operations of a set of assets, providing support to the Property Managers regarding all repairs and investment plans.


This is a remote FM role based out of the San Juan area. We are needing someone with flexibility as this position requires on call hours outside of standard business hours.


**What You’ll Do:**
* Provide formal supervision to employees. Monitor the training and development of staff. Conduct performance evaluations and coaching. Oversee the recruiting and hiring of new employees.
* Schedule and manage the team's daily activities. Establish work schedules, assign tasks, and cross\-train staff. Set and track staff and department deadlines. Mentor and coach as needed.
* Coordinate and manage facility repairs and maintenance by working with technicians, vendors, and contractors.
* Maintain positive client relationships and conduct meetings on unresolved facility issues.
* Prepare and manage capital projects, operating budgets, and variance reports.
* Perform facility inspections quality assurance following local, state, and federal regulations. Suggest operational efficiencies, repairs, and upgrade opportunities.
* Manage environmental health and safety procedures for facilities.
* Oversee vendor relationships and invoicing procedures. Review price quotes for the procurement of parts, services, and labor for projects.
* Conduct process and procedure training on maintenance, repairs, and safety best practices.
* Lead by example and model behaviors that are consistent with CBRE RISE values. Influence parties of shared interests to reach an agreement.
* Apply knowledge of own discipline and how own discipline integrates with others to achieve team and departmental objectives.
* Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve day\-to\-day and moderately complex issues which may or may not be evident in existing systems and processes.


**What You’ll Need:*** Bachelor's Degree preferred with 3\-5 years of relevant experience. In lieu of a degree, a combination of experience and education will be considered. Valid driver's license required. Facility Management certification preferred.
* Experience in the areas of staffing, selection, training, development, coaching, mentoring, measuring, appraising, and rewarding performance and retention preferred.
* Ability to guide the exchange of sensitive, complicated, and difficult information, convey performance expectations and handle problems.
* Leadership skills to motivate team impact on quality, efficiency, and effectiveness of the job discipline and department.
* Extensive organizational skills with a strong inquisitive mindset.
* Advanced math skills. Ability to calculate difficult figures such as percentages, fractions, and other financial\-related calculations.

**Equal Employment Opportunity:** CBRE has a long\-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

CBRE provides reasonable accommodations in job application procedures for individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance due to a disability in the application or recruitment process, please submit a request via email at recruitingaccommodations@cbre.com or via telephone at \+1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and \+1 866 388 4346 (Canada).

**Customer Service Team Lead**

Customer Service Team Lead

We are looking for a Players Development Team Leader for the Casino Real Caguas. The Players Development Team Leader assists, supports, and coordinates processes related to the Players Club as assigned. They are responsible for assisting casino management with customer management, especially marketing\-related matters. The role focuses on identifying and developing both current and potential casino customers and assisting in the organization of customer events and promotions.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Assist in the development and operation of the Players Club.
* Identify the top 100 slot machine players weekly to award them incentive bonuses and notify them of the corresponding bonuses via text message.
* Follow up to ensure customers claim and use their bonuses at the casino.
* Generate a monthly report on table players who have accumulated 10 or more hours of play to allocate incentives according to the Bono Real guidelines, and notify them of their bonuses via text message.
* Follow up to ensure table customers claim and use their bonuses.
* Maintain an updated customer list and complete weekly telemarketing campaigns.
* Coordinate and manage special events.
* Prepare the Players Club team's work schedule or itinerary for approval by the manager.
* Conduct training and development of Players Club staff.
* Refer to the manager any issues related to noncompliance with processes, service, Players Club operations, or company standards.
* Keep table and machine customers informed of all promotions and events.
* Ensure quality service to all staff who visit the facilities and are members of the Players Club.
* Guide, monitor, and lead the motivation and compliance of the team in support of the manager and operations.
* Contribute to the efficiency and development of strategies for the Players Club, working as a team with the Players Club Manager and agents.
* Cover or assist in the Players Club area when needed.
* Comply with casino SOPs, departmental procedures, and company policies.
* Support hotel departments when required.
* Provide excellent service.
* Requirements and Qualifications:

Education: Minimum of a High School Diploma and bilingual (Spanish and English). A valid Tourism License is also required.

Experience: One (1\) year of prior experience in areas related to marketing, teamwork, and customer service.

Availability: Must be available to work variable/rotating shifts, weekends, and holidays.

Language Skills: Ability to communicate correctly, effectively, and clearly in Spanish and English. Ability to write simple documents and present information effectively.

Mathematical Skills: Ability to add and subtract two\-digit numbers, and multiply and divide multiples of 10 and 100\. Ability to create reports in Excel.

Reasoning Skills: Ability to understand and apply detailed instructions, deal with problems involving specific variables in everyday situations, and navigate situations with high levels of stress and movement.

Equipment and Tools: You will use general office equipment and a Tourism License.

* Life insurance

**The Opportunity**

The Assistant Manager Quality (AMQ) reports to the Associate Director Quality.


**The Role**

* Ensure the center is "inspection ready" by managing adherence to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), compliance policies and the quality system.
* Manage the Quality Control program, calibrations management, monitor of compliance to defined processes e.g. sampling, competency checks, trending and analysis of KPIs, cause and failure mode impact assessment and change management.
* You will recruit, hire, conduct performance reviews, lead investigations and deviations, enact corrective actions, and termination.
* Comply with all Health Safety and Environmental (HSE) and Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), federal, state and local regulatory, company policies and procedures.
* Follow all HR policies and practices through fair treatment of all employees.
* Monitor CAPA's and effectiveness checks to ensure issues are resolved.
* Overnight travel required up to 10% of the time.

**Your skills and experience**

**Education**

Bachelor's Degree preferred OR equivalent combination of education and professional work experience required


**Experience**

* 1 year supervisory, leadership experience responsible for overseeing the activities of others OR Completion of CSL Plasma Leadership Development program
* 1year Quality experience (CSA/CSAb) required

Additional Comments


* Maintain company Technical Training certification
* Knowledge of complex government and industry regulations, and ability to monitor compliance with these regulations
* Manage entire financial responsibility of the center
* Proficient in English

**Working Conditions**

* Exposure to hazardous chemicals, extreme temperatures and to bloodborne pathogens.
* Required to wear Personal Protective Equipment while performing tasks or in certain areas

Jobtracks Caribbean actualmente se encuentra en la búsqueda de un Técnico de Calidad para cubrir una vacante ubicada en Cayey, Puerto Rico. El candidato ideal deberá garantizar la calidad de los productos y asegurar que estos cumplen con los estándares de calidad requeridos, en línea con los objetivos de la empresa y en cumplimiento de las normativas de calidad, protección ambiental, así como de salud y seguridad laboral establecidas.

**Requisitos del Técnico de Calidad**

* Un Técnico de Calidad debe tener un grado Asociado en Ciencias Naturales, Química, Microbiología o Biología.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe tener experiencia de 1 año en puestos similares.
* Conocimientos generales en Instrumentos de Laboratorio, técnicas analíticas, interpretación de resultados, materiales químicos, matemáticas.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe tener un inglés básico.
* Conocimiento en técnicas asépticas de muestreo.
* Conocimiento en Microsoft office.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe tener conocimientos mínimos en Sistemas Integrados de Gestión.

**Beneficios del Técnico de Calidad**

* Salario $11\.00 p/h.
* Tiempo completo.

**Responsabilidades del Técnico de Calidad**

* Un Técnico de Calidad debe supervisar el proceso de producción y garantizar su eficiencia y calidad durante el turno asignado.
* Realizar pruebas de control de calidad conforme a los estándares establecidos para los productos envasados.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe registrar meticulosamente los resultados de las pruebas y análisis en la documentación adecuada, siguiendo protocolos de documentación precisos.
* Verificar regularmente la calibración de los equipos antes del inicio de cada turno.
* Supervisar y auditar los procedimientos de limpieza y saneamiento.
* Recopilar y procesar muestras microbiológicas según los procedimientos establecidos.
* Introducir los resultados de las pruebas en los programas informáticos correspondientes para su análisis estadístico.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe implementar y cumplir con los procedimientos de retención de producto terminado y materias primas.
* Mantener un entorno de trabajo limpio y ordenado al final de cada turno.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe participar activamente en la validación de nuevos procesos de producción.
* Colaborar en proyectos adicionales según sea necesario.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe reportar de inmediato al supervisor cualquier accidente que afecte a productos, equipos, instalaciones o personal.
* Notificar cualquier situación que pueda representar un riesgo para la calidad del producto, los equipos, las instalaciones o el personal.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe cumplir con los requisitos del Sistema Integrado de Gestión de la empresa.
* Asegurar el cumplimiento de las políticas, procedimientos y procesos establecidos por la empresa.
* Un Técnico de Calidad debe realizar cualquier otra tarea relacionada con el puesto que se le asigne.
* Disponibilidad completa para turnos de 12 horas.

**Job Summary**  
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Store Manager to lead our retail team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing daily operations, driving sales growth, and ensuring exceptional customer service. This role requires strong leadership skills, a keen understanding of retail management, and the ability to motivate and develop a diverse team. The Store Manager will play a crucial role in maintaining store standards, managing inventory, and enhancing the overall shopping experience for our customers.

**Duties**

* Oversee daily store operations, ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
* Lead, train, and develop team members to enhance their skills in customer service, sales, and operational excellence.
* Manage inventory control processes including ordering, stocking, and merchandising to maximize sales opportunities.
* Implement effective marketing strategies to promote store promotions and drive foot traffic.
* Conduct employee orientation and training sessions to ensure all staff are equipped with necessary knowledge and skills.
* Utilize POS systems for transaction processing while ensuring cash handling procedures are followed.
* Monitor sales performance metrics and adjust strategies as needed to achieve sales targets.
* Foster a positive work environment that encourages teamwork, communication, and professional growth.
* Engage in recruiting efforts to attract top talent for various positions within the store.

**Experience**

* Proven experience in retail management or supervisory roles with a focus on team management and customer service.
* Strong negotiation skills with the ability to resolve conflicts effectively.
* Familiarity with retail math concepts including pricing strategies, budgeting, and inventory management.
* Experience in merchandising techniques that drive sales performance.
* Bilingual or multilingual capabilities are a plus for enhancing customer interactions.
* Proficient in administrative functions including scheduling, time management, and organizational skills.
* We invite qualified candidates who possess strong leadership qualities and a passion for retail to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Store Manager.

* Monitorea las operaciones de los servicios de alimentos para asegurarse de que se siguen los procedimientos.
* Examina las instalaciones, el equipo o las fuentes para asegurar conformidad a los estándares.
* Registra los datos operativos o de producción.
* Cocina alimentos.
* Mantiene los inventarios de alimentos, bebida, o del equipo.

 **Responsabilidades de Supervisión:**  

* Este puesto no supervisa personal.
 **Ambiente de Trabajo:**  

* Este puesto se desempeña en un ambiente movido y de alto tráfico de clientes.
* Este puesto participa en actividades en un ambiente variado, cambiante y exigente.
* Este puesto no está expuesto a áreas confinadas ni a condiciones ambientales adversas, tampoco a materiales o productos peligros.
* Este puesto utiliza instrumentos y equipo común de una barra o salón del restaurante.

 **Demandas Físicas:**  

* Las demandas físicas descritas aquí son representativas de las que debe cumplir un empleado para realizar con éxito las funciones esenciales de este trabajo.
* Es mayormente un trabajo que requiere estar de pie y caminar por periodos prolongados, así como hablar para asistir a socios y clientes invitados.
* Este puesto está expuesto a levantar, empujar y halar objetos ligeramente pesados, mayormente materiales y equipos para el salón del restaurante tales como mesas, sillas, entre otros.
* Mientras realiza las funciones de este trabajo, el empleado se requiere regularmente para hablar o escuchar.
* El empleado con frecuencia está obligado a ponerse de pie; caminar; usar las manos y dedos, manejar o sentir; y alcanzar con las manos y los brazos.
* Ocasionalmente se requiere que el empleado se siente; suba o se equilibre, se agache o arrodille.
* Las habilidades de visión específicas requeridas por este trabajo incluyen visión cercana, visión a distancia, visión del color, visión periférica, percepción de profundidad y capacidad para ajustar el enfoque.

 **Tipo de Puesto y Horas de Trabajo:**  

* No exento
* Trabaja un mínimo de 8 horas diarias y 40 horas semanales.
* Debe estar disponible para trabajar en un horario flexible, mayormente fines de semana y noches, según las necesidades del restaurante.

* No es requerido viajar

* Experiencia en alimentos, hospitalidad y servicio al cliente.

 **Educación y Experiencia Deseada:**  

* Grado Asociado o Bachillerato en Cocina o Alimentos.
* 3 – 5 años de experiencia en el campo de la hospitalidad, servicio de alimentos
* Bilingüe español e inglés (hablado y escrito)

**SUMMARY**


Responsible for Supervising the Network Engineering Operations (NEO) Group members dedicated to voice and data services. Supervises and manages the network and all equipment and technical issues related to its operation and performance. Manages all activities related to the operations and maintenance of the VoIP Softswitch, MPLS, and Internet Service Provider’s equipment, including but not limited to servers, switches, routers, and databases. Provides Level 3 support for all voice and data services provided and issues related to Network Core components. Provides voice and data networking technical knowledge and expertise to design and implement appropriate solutions using company's products and service bundles.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES** include the following. Other duties may be assigned

* Plan, supervise and coordinate all tasks related to the operation, provisioning, maintenance, and service restoration of all network related activities.
* Supervise technical staff, including performance evaluation, workload distribution, training, and performance reports of NEO personnel.
* Provide technical support to other members of Engineering and Strategic Planning Department in the operation and implementation of existing and new facilities for company such as POP (Points of Presence), MPLS, switches, network servers and application, , etc.
* Supports Engineering and Strategic Planning Department in the development and management of negotiations with vendors to ensure collocation, interconnection, as well as product and equipment solutions.
* Develop, implement, and monitor a 24\-hour maintenance and backup plan to keep network’s service level optimum without intrusions and/or interruptions.
* Establish and maintain performance guidelines, develop documentation and procedures to meet company objectives.
* Recommend and implement new strategies, technologies and equipment for network optimization, to meet performance standards.
* Provides network status reports and operational issues such as, but not limited to, network outages and performance.
* Ensures that network technical support is provided to the organization’s internal/external customers on WorldNet provided services.
* Advises and supports on all internal technical needs.
* Actively promotes and encourages teamwork among peers and employees.
* Research, recommend and implement new equipment and/or solutions that align with company strategies and new product development.
* Supports Engineering, Sales, Operations and Finance Departments regarding technical and/or Network related issues.
* Maintains a customer service driven approach directed toward customer retention, market share gain, and growth.
* Keeps abreast of developments in telecommunications, VoIP and networking technologies and makes recommendations to the engineering group and Director.
* Interface with customer on difficult configuration and architectural issues.
* Training and mentoring NEO Technicians.
* Restore network from network outage situations by managing events amongst multiple groups.
* Coordinate/Perform maintenance and migrations activities.
* Manage MPLS, Internet and VoIP Networks to meet industry standard performance metrics.
* Prepare and document departmental procedures and improvements to company applications as related to NEO processes.
* Performs all other duties as required.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**


Directly supervises Network, ISP, laboratory technicians, database and servers’ administrators, network administrators and/or consultants and other personnel as assigned by organization. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems and encouraging and supporting personal and professional growth through specific plans and consistent support.

**QUALIFICATIONS**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE**


Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university; and six years minimum related experience and/or training. At least two years of experience as Supervisor.

**LANGUAGE SKILLS**


Ability to read, analyze, and interpret complex technical documents. Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints. Ability to write speeches and articles using original or innovative techniques or style. Ability to make effective and persuasive speeches and presentations on controversial or complex topics to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.


 Fully Bilingual (Spanish \- English)

**MATHEMATICAL SKILLS**


Ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts such as exponents, logarithms, quadratic equations, and permutations. Ability to apply mathematical operations to such tasks as frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, correlation techniques, sampling theory, and factor analysis.

**REASONING ABILITY**


Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems. Ability to deal with nonverbal symbolism (formulas, scientific equations, graphs, musical notes, etc.,) in its most difficult phases. Ability to deal with a variety of abstract and concrete variables. Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

**OTHER SKILLS**

* Able to work with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, Power Point, etc.
* Project Management
* Reengineering
* Problem Solving Abilities
* Training Design
* Strong relationship Skills
* Conflict resolution
* Motivation skills
* Highly organized to handle large number of simultaneous activities in a very fast paced environment, yet flexible enough to respond quickly to critical issues.
* Must be a strong communicator, skilled in developing and maintaining key professional relationships.
* Working knowledge of access network issues that impact VoIP performance as well as their measurement and analysis.
* The Network Operations Manager must have in depth expertise in MPLS and its performance.
* from the edge through the core of the network and strong working knowledge of MPLS, data communications and Internet knowledge including TCP/UDP/IP, routing, tunneling, PPP, Frame Relay, and mobile IP. Additionally, this individual will have expertise in a wide range of data network access; from Analog modems to Broadband technologies (Ethernet, VRF, VPLS, Wireless, etc.) including home networking and traditional telecommunications technologies such as SONET, TDM, etc.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Performing the duties of this job requires the employee to sit, stand, and bend, and a normal range of hearing and vision. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus; due to driving needs.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


 Normal office environment, usually quiet. No physical discomfort or exposure to hazardous things due to temperature, dust, noise, etc. Able to work in a fast\-paced environment with continuous interruptions.
